verses.verse: ((1 Cor. 1:26)) Great men are not always wise, Nor do the aged always understand justice.
“Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me, I also will declare my opinion.’
Indeed I waited for your words, I listened to your reasonings, while you searched out what to say.
I paid close attention to you; And surely not one of you convinced Job, Or answered his words—
((Jer. 9:23; 1 Cor. 1:29)) Lest you say, ‘We have found wisdom’; God will vanquish him, not man.
Now he has not directed his words against me; So I will not answer him with your words.
“They are dismayed and answer no more; Words escape them.
And I have waited, because they did not speak, Because they stood still and answered no more.
I also will answer my part, I too will declare my opinion.
For I am full of words; The spirit within me compels me.
Indeed my belly is like wine that has no vent; It is ready to burst like new wineskins.
I will speak, that I may find relief; I must open my lips and answer.
Let me not, I pray, show partiality to anyone; Nor let me flatter any man.
For I do not know how to flatter, Else my Maker would soon take me (Job 27:8) away.
(Elihu Contradicts Job) “But please, Job, hear my speech, And listen to all my words.
Now, I open my mouth; My tongue speaks in my mouth.
My words come from my upright heart; My lips utter pure knowledge.
((Gen. 2:7); Job 32:8) The Spirit of God has made me, And the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
If you can answer me, Set your words in order before me; Take your stand.
(Job 4:19) Truly I am as your spokesman before God; I also have been formed out of clay.
(Job 9:34) Surely no fear of me will terrify you, Nor will my hand be heavy on you.
“Surely you have spoken in my hearing, And I have heard the sound of your words, saying,
‘I (Job 10:7) am pure, without transgression; I am innocent, and there is no iniquity in me.
Yet He finds occasions against me, (Job 13:24; 16:9) He counts me as His enemy;
(Job 13:27; 19:8) He puts my feet in the stocks, He watches all my paths.’
“Look, in this you are not righteous. I will answer you, For God is greater than man.
Why do you (Job 40:2; (Is. 45:9)) contend with Him? For He does not give an accounting of any of His words.
(Job 33:29; 40:5; Ps. 62:11) For God may speak in one way, or in another, Yet man does not perceive it.
((Num. 12:6)) In a dream, in a vision of the night, When deep sleep falls upon men, While slumbering on their beds,
((Job 36:10, 15)) Then He opens the ears of men, And seals their instruction.
In order to turn man from his deed, And conceal pride from man,
He keeps back his soul from the Pit, And his life from perishing by the sword.
“Man is also chastened with pain on his (Job 30:17) bed, And with strong pain in many of his bones,
